intro: Castilleja pulchella var. acutina, commonly known as the acuteleaf Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red or orange flowers that resemble paintbrushes. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on host plants for some of its nutritional needs. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native range.
